abstract.text: Saves game data with the specified name.

inlineContent.text: An object that contains the saved game data.
A unique filename for the saved game data.
The block that this method calls when it completes the request.
The block receives the following parameters:
The saved game.
savedGame
Describes an error if it occurs, or
if the operation completes.
error
If the
parameter is an existing filename, GameKit overwrites the file with the new game data.
You must provide an iCloud container ID in your project to save game data to the player’s iCloud account. Add the
key to your project containing a unique identifier for your game.

abstract.text: The container identifiers for the iCloud production environment.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
The local player who signs in to Game Center on the device running the game.
Deletes saved games with the specified filename.
Replaces duplicate saved games that use the same filename with one file containing the specified game data.
Saves game data with the specified name.
An object that represents a file containing saved game data.
A protocol that handles events related to saving game data.
Save game data during play or after a game in the player’s iCloud account that’s accessible from any device.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Saving the player’s game data to an iCloud account

abstract.text: A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
